text1: RESOURCE

The Furry Plasma Weapon. The engine is so stronk it is itself the warhead. Let your target's flux system feel the fury of the Furry, and their hull melt... green with envy.

Low Tier God of Furries, owo.

The Furry Plasma Weapon. The engine is so stronk it is itself the warhead. Let your target's flux system feel the fury of the Furry, and their hull melt... green with envy.

uwu.

A rack of Furry Plasma Weapons and their stronk engines. Let your target's flux system feel the fury of the Furry, and their hull melt... green with envy.

Twice the uwu.

A reliable launch platform for the fast, volatile, and oh so uwu, Furry Plasma Weapon. A built-in capacitor removes a lesser mount's flux cost. Not for the target's flux system or hull.

uwu for days.

The Feathers will fly in a burst of 8 not so deadly but oh so numerous freshly hatched plasma feathered friends aimed to make fighters vacate your airspace with prejudice discreetly

Shhh.

The Feathers will fly in a burst of 8 not so deadly but oh so numerous freshly hatched plasma feathered friends aimed to make fighters vacate your airspace with prejudice

Quack.

The Feathers will fly in a burst of 16 not so deadly but oh so numerous freshly hatched plasma feathered friends aimed to make fighter pilots NOT worth their salt into salt

HONK.

The Feathers will fly in a burst of 32 not so deadly but awe-inspiring -and spammy- freshly hatched plasma feathered friends aimed to make fighter pilots NOT worth their salt into dust

HONK HONK.

A Beam Emitter with a Slaved AI core, and no sense of personal space, it minces right up to target craft and gets quite touchy and feely with hulls and shield systems... well and anything in the way. Can be quite the charmer and very disarming when it tries and the target weapon systems tend to agree... along with jealous engines.

Can be quite the charmer and very disarming when it tries and the target weapon systems tend to agree... along with jealous engines.
Personed by a thotty thirsty member of the crew or military, they use their powaa to track targets and eliminate them with this cannon.
Personed by a much thottier much thirstier member of the crew or military, they use their powaa to track targets and eliminate them with this powaaful cannon.
Personed by one of the thottiest and thirstiest members of the crew or military, they use their extreme powaa to track targets and eliminate them with this powaaful cannon.

Personed by one of the thottiest and thirstiest members of the crew or military, who tend to stalk, they use their extreme powaa to track targets and eliminate them with this powaaful cannon... discreetly
A Fox for all your raiding the henhouse needs. Bring Several to cover all entrances and exits for maximum target penetration.
A Confusion of Weasels for filling lonely sad hangars. Bring Several Confusions to cover all entrances and exits for loneliness removal. So friendly.

Originally found adrift, the Hermit could not leave the poor vessel to wander the stars alone a second longer. Careful funds were allocated to the distant families, and a refit crew acquired. Packed with fighters, pilots, and other crew... loneliness is a thing of the past once again. She has an audience to dance for afterall.

Purchased by the Hermit themselves for simulator work alone. Physical Design the only trade secret of her manufacture, and it will suffice. Otherwise the fleet doctrine is already outfitted with fighters. Maybe there's a lost secret of the past of the former sleeper and forlorn friend to Furries... well and other Strays.

Activates the ship's defensive battery of flares and intercept missiles, flooding the immediate area with ordinance. At the same time, the ships engage its emergency thrusters to perform a 180 degree turn, allowing it to escape at maximum speed.

The Hermit slept for ... well just too long. Adrift, Isolated. He'd wake get his bearings, sigh, and sleep again till an automated system roused him once more. The last time was serendipity. A collision. A vessel equally adrift, but fueled! Towing his podcraft with this new hopefully not orphaned bird, he spent a year seeking their owner and in so doing The Hermit Blown in on a Blue Breeze has since rejoined the sector, and has a penchant for giving derelict, junked, and adrift vessels new homes. His personal and organization beliefs get him accused of being an AI.

His adherents, adopting the moniker hermit, and seeking out the abandoned, the derelict, the 'frightened' and finding them new home berths, or service if the metal is willing. Neither pronoun nor 'species' matter. But do keep an open mind. Or you may run afoul of other adherents like the Hare of a Head Engineer or their subordinate Scalie Wrodrax Thothunter. One is too angry the other too... amourous. And both not even the tip of the eccelectic iceberg.
But worth noting.




'Rumor has it they held a funeral for a [censored][Redacted] Vessel. Tired of immortality or some shit. Scuttled, and tossed into a star. Full rights like ya'd give a Hegemony Admiral. Shoulda just blasted it at range. Ludd take all the damn cores out and toss them into a star! THAT will be real cause for ceremony!' - Pather Scuttlebutte, or Brother Mortimer to his friends.
